easypets.config.title: EasyPets Configuration
easypets.config.usage_view: Use /petconfig <setting> to see details about a specific setting
easypets.config.usage_reset: Use /petconfig <setting> reset to reset a setting
easypets.config.usage_reset_all: Use /petconfig reset all to reset all settings
easypets.config.setting.title: %s
easypets.config.reset_all_success: [EasyPets] All settings have been reset to default values
easypets.config.reset_all_hint: Use /petconfig to view the current configuration
easypets.config.warning.chunk_loading_di: Note: Existing chunk tickets will auto-expire in 5 seconds
easypets.config.warning.auto_recover_dis: Note: Players will need to manually run /petrecovery when they first join
easypets.config.warning.auto_recover_ena: Note: Pet recovery will automatically run 5 seconds after first join
easypets.config.warning.dynamic_running_: Note: Pet speeds will return to vanilla behavior
easypets.config.warning.natural_regen_di: Note: Pets will no longer regenerate health automatically
easypets.config.warning.debug_logging_en: Warning: Debug logging will create additional console output
easypets.config.warning.high_chunk_dista: Warning: High chunk distances may impact server performance
easypets.config.warning.high_navigation_: Warning: Very high navigation ranges may cause server lag
easypets.config.warning.low_navigation_r: Note: Very low navigation ranges may cause pets to pathfind poorly
easypets.config.warning.low_teleport_dis: Note: Very low teleport distances may cause pets to teleport frequently
easypets.config.warning.high_teleport_di: Note: Very high teleport distances may cause pets to get lost more easily
easypets.config.warning.high_running_mul: Warning: Very high running multipliers may look unnatural or cause pathfinding issues
easypets.config.warning.low_target_dista: Note: Very low target distances may cause frequent speed changes
easypets.config.warning.high_regen_rate: Warning: Very high regeneration rates may make pets overpowered
easypets.config.warning.short_regen_dela: Note: Very short delays may make pets regenerate too quickly after damage
easypets.config.warning.long_regen_delay: Note: Very long delays may make regeneration feel unresponsive
easypets.config.warning.low_max_health: Note: Low max health percentages mean pets will need manual healing
easypets.config.setting.enableChunkLoadi: Enable/disable the entire chunk loading system
Set to false to use only /petlocate without chunk loading
Server owners who want pets to locate but not load chunks
easypets.config.setting.teleportDistance: Distance in blocks before pets try to teleport to owner
Vanilla default is 12 blocks. Lower = pets stay closer
Adjust based on your server's playstyle preferences
easypets.config.setting.maxChunkDistance: Radius of chunks to keep loaded around each pet
Higher values increase server load but provide more stability
Only increase if pets are having chunk loading issues
easypets.config.setting.navigationScanni: Maximum navigation range in blocks for pet pathfinding
Higher values let pets search further before teleporting
Increase if pets have trouble pathfinding, decrease for performance
easypets.config.setting.autoRecoverOnFir: Automatically run pet recovery when joining world for first time
Helps players find their pets when first installing the mod on existing worlds
Enable for user-friendly experience, disable if you prefer manual control
easypets.config.setting.enableDynamicRun: Enable/disable dynamic pet running adjustment system
Pets will run faster when you're moving fast and they're far away
Disable if you prefer vanilla pet following behavior
easypets.config.setting.runningTargetDis: Distance in blocks where pets start running faster
Pets closer than this distance use normal speed
Lower values = pets run faster more often, higher = only when far
easypets.config.setting.maxRunningMultip: Maximum running speed multiplier when catching up
Higher values help pets keep up but may look unnatural
Adjust based on desired pet movement balance
easypets.config.setting.playerMovementTh: Minimum player movement to trigger pet speed changes
Very low value - prevents speed changes from tiny movements
easypets.config.setting.enableNaturalReg: Enable/disable natural health regeneration for pets
Pets will slowly regenerate health when not taking damage
Enable for easier pet management, disable for vanilla behavior
Delay in ticks before regeneration starts after taking damage
Higher values = longer wait after damage for balance
Increase if regen feels too overpowered, decrease for faster healing
easypets.config.setting.regenAmountPerSe: Amount of health regenerated per second
Default is similar to horse regeneration speed
Adjust based on desired healing speed and game balance
easypets.config.setting.regenMaxHealthPe: Maximum health percentage to regenerate to
1.0 = 100% health, 0.8 = 80% health. Prevents full healing if desired
Set to less than 1.0 if you want pets to need some manual healing
easypets.config.setting.saveOnLocate.des: Trigger world save when /petlocate is used
easypets.config.setting.saveOnLocate.det: Ensures most accurate pet locations but makes command slower
easypets.config.setting.saveOnLocate.whe: Enable if pet locations are frequently inaccurate
easypets.config.setting.saveOnRecovery.d: Improves recovery success rate but makes command slower
easypets.config.setting.saveOnRecovery.w: Enable if pet recovery often fails to find pets
easypets.config.setting.enableDebugLoggi: Enable detailed console logging for troubleshooting
Only enable when investigating issues - creates log spam
Disable after troubleshooting to reduce server logs
easypets.config.setting.language.descrip: Server language for all mod messages and commands, Currently only English is supported, if you want to help translate please visit the project's github
easypets.config.setting.language.details: Changes take effect immediately. Falls back to English if translation missing
easypets.config.setting.glowDurationSeco: Duration in seconds for pet glow effects when using /findpets command
Shorter durations reduce visual clutter, longer durations help when searching for pets
Adjust based on how long you need to see glowing pets
easypets.auto_recovery.once: This will only happen once. Use /petrecovery to run manually.
easypets.auto_recovery.saving: Ensuring world is saved for accurate pet data...
easypets.calmpets.explanation: Your pets have stopped attacking and targets have been whitelisted to prevent re-targeting.
easypets.calmpets.no_attacking_pets: No pets were currently attacking anything.
easypets.petwhitelist.title: Pet Whitelist Commands
easypets.petwhitelist.help.add: /petwhitelist add <entities> - Prevent your pets from attacking entities
easypets.petwhitelist.help.remove: /petwhitelist remove <entities> - Allow your pets to attack entities again
easypets.petwhitelist.help.explanation: Whitelisted players and entities will not be attacked by your pets.
easypets.petwhitelist.help.examples: Examples: Steve, @p, @a[team=friendly], @e[type=zombie], UUID from tab-completing while looking at entity
easypets.petwhitelist.player_added: Added %s to your pet whitelist. Your pets will not attack them.
easypets.petwhitelist.player_removed: Removed %s from your pet whitelist. Your pets can attack them again.
easypets.petwhitelist.entity_added: Added %s to your pet whitelist. Your pets will not attack them.
easypets.petwhitelist.entity_removed: Removed %s from your pet whitelist. Your pets can attack them again.
easypets.petwhitelist.list_empty: Your whitelist is empty. Use /petwhitelist add to add entries.
easypets.petwhitelist.cleared: Cleared your pet whitelist (%s entries removed).
easypets.petwhitelist.already_empty: Your pet whitelist is already empty.
